derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from Dutch kruiser, from kruisen (see cruise)

entry.def: A cruiser is a motor boat which has an area for people to live or sleep.
A cruiser is a large fast warship.

example.ex: Italy had lost three cruisers and two destroyers.
example.tran: 意大利损失了3艘巡洋舰和2艘驱逐舰。

entry.def: A cruiser is a police car.

means.word_mean: 1. a car in which policemen cruise the streets; equipped with radiotelephonic communications to headquarters
2. a large fast warship; smaller than a battleship and larger than a destroyer
3. a large motorboat that has a cabin and plumbing and other conveniences necessary for living on board

stems_affixes.value_cn: 残酷的, 悲惨的, 使痛苦的
stems_affixes.word_buile: cru粗野,残酷+el→adj.残酷的, 悲惨的, 使痛苦的
cruel残酷的+ty表名词→n.残忍, 残酷
cru十字形,交叉+ise表名词→n.乘船巡游
cruise[v.巡航;以节省燃料的速度前进]+er表名词→n.巡洋舰;有船舱的游艇
